title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Slick R package designed visualizing exploring results Management Strategy Evaluation (MSE). Slick allows MSE developers analysts prepare MSE results standardized data structure, easily generate publication quality figures tables, present explore MSE results interactive application. document guide analysts wish use Slick summarize present MSE results.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Slick released CRAN future. meantime, Slick can installed Github:
code: # install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('blue-matter/Slick') library(Slick)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Please use Issues feature GitHub repository report issues bugs. sure include reproducible example issue can recreated debugging. Pull Requests also welcome.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Slick developed Blue Matter Science designed commissioned Ocean Foundation’s International Fisheries Conservation Project harveststrategies.org, support Pew Charitable Trusts Common Oceans Tuna Fisheries Project funded GEF implemented FAO. prototype figure designs developed 5W Infographics. Slick going development. feedback welcome. Please contact Shana Miller comments suggestions development.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: use Slick, MSE results must compiled Slick Object. object designed compatible results MSE framework. Slick Object contains information shown plots tables, well metadata information title, introduction, author details. contents Slick Object can grouped following categories: Metadata: information including title, introduction, author details MPs: details Management Procedures OMs: factors, levels, information relating Operating Models Plots: details values Performance Indicators Slick Plots

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Slick Object can include following plots: Time Series: Plots time series user-specified variable (e.g., yield, biomass) historical period projection period management procedure. Boxplot: Displays minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, maximum set results. Includes option display data violin plot. Kobe: Compares performance MPs respect biomass (x-axis) fishing mortality (y-axis). Includes option display data Kobe Time plot, shows percentage runs fall Kobe quadrants projection year. Quilt: table performance indicators management procedure, colored shading indicate better/worse performance. Spider: Shows results three performance indicators, represented axis starting center point. Sometimes also called Radar plot. Tradeoff: Scatter plot comparing two performance indicators. valid Slick Object must include least one Slick Plot.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Slick can used rapidly create standardized plots tables MSE results directly R console. See sections examples. plots tables can also viewed Slick App, interactive application developed Shiny. Slick App allows users upload data customize plots filtering management procedures, operating models, performance indicators. App can launched directly R console : App also hosted online. online App publicly accessible can used presenting examining MSE results stakeholders decision-makers. Analysts can either share Slick Object audience directly upload App, analysts can upload Slick Object Slick Object Library, added list Slick Objects can loaded directly within App.
code: App()

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: order populate example Slick Object, need define operating models (OMs), management procedures (MPs), generate quantitative values Performance Indicators relating Slick Plot. , using openMSE platform create example MSE objects set MPs several different OMs. reproduce example, need install openMSE package run code following sub-sections. Alternatively, can follow code plotting sections replace example OMs, MPs, Performance Indicator values shown MSE.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
code: pak::pkg_install('blue-matter/openMSE') library(openMSE)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: example, creating three operating models: Base: Base Case model (entirely fictional) Albacore fishery Low M: robustness model natural mortality (M) 25% lower Base Case model High M: robustness model M 33% higher Base Case model OM 12 individual simulations (nsim=12). OMs include uncertainty life-history parameters depletion end historical period (D=c(0.3,0.4)).
code: nsim <- 12 OM_Base <- new('OM', Albacore, Generic_IncE, Generic_Obs, nsim=nsim) OM_Base@D <- c(0.3,0.4)  OM_LowM <- OM_HighM <- OM_Base OM_LowM@M <- OM_Base@M * 0.75 OM_HighM@M <- OM_Base@M * 1.3333

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: using four example management procedures DLMtool package: AvC: TAC fixed years average catch historical period Itarget1: TAC iteratively adjusted reach target CPUE DD: simple delay-difference assessment model used estimate current biomass (B)(B) UMSYU_{MSY}, TAC=UMSYB\text{TAC}= U_{MSY}B SPmod: TAC incrementally adjusted based apparent trend surplus production. MPs used examples, details don’t really matter. ’re interested can see DLMtool help documentation details MP.
code: MPs <- c('AvC', 'Itarget1', 'DD', 'SPmod')

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: runMSE function used spool historical fishery dynamics run closed-loop simulation testing four MPs three OMS: sections , MSE objects used calculate performance indicators Slick Plot.
code: MSE_Base <- runMSE(OM_Base, MPs=MPs, silent = TRUE) MSE_LowM <- runMSE(OM_LowM, MPs=MPs, silent = TRUE) MSE_HighM <- runMSE(OM_HighM, MPs=MPs, silent = TRUE)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: create Slick Object, simply use Slick() function: slick S4 object class Slick: slots class Slick objects correspond information title, subtitle, author Slick object, operating models (OMs), management procedures (MPs) included Slick object, details corresponding Slick Plots: slot can accessed assigned using function corresponding slot name; e.g.: sections provide examples populating Slick object.
code: slick <- Slick() class(slick) #> [1] "Slick" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "Slick" slotNames('Slick') #>  [1] "Title"        "Subtitle"     "Date"         "Author"       "Email"        #>  [6] "Institution"  "Introduction" "MPs"          "OMs"          "Boxplot"      #> [11] "Kobe"         "Quilt"        "Spider"       "Timeseries"   "Tradeoff" Date(slick) #> [1] "2024-10-02" Date(slick) <- Sys.Date()

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Title, Subtitle, Date, Author, Email, Institution functions used populate corresponding information Slick Object. metadata optional, useful presenting Slick results App: functions used return information stored Slick Object:
code: Title(slick) <- 'An Example Slick Object' Subtitle(slick) <- "This is the subtitle" Date(slick) <- Sys.Date() Author(slick) <- 'Adrian Hordyk' Email(slick) <-  "[adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) <- "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)" Title(slick) #> [1] "An Example Slick Object" Subtitle(slick) #> [1] "This is the subtitle" Date(slick) #> [1] "2024-10-02" Author(slick) #> [1] "Adrian Hordyk" Email(slick) #> [1] "[adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) #> [1] "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)"

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: exception Date, Markdown can used include links, text styling, etc, text Slick Object. example: Markdown automatically converted HTML App. Use markdown=TRUE argument print HTML code console (document HTML text rendered directly horizontal lines): example Slick object. created purposes demonstrating key features Slick. introduction can include paragraphs well Markdown italics bold text Links.
code: Introduction(slick) <- "  This is an example Slick object. It has been created for the purposes of demonstrating the key features of Slick.  The introduction can include paragraphs as well as Markdown such as *italics* and **bold** text and [Links](https://slick.bluematterscience.com).  " Introduction(slick, markdown = TRUE)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Author character vector element author: Email, Institution must character vectors length Author:
code: Author(slick) <- c('A. Author', 'B. Author') Email(slick) <- c('[a.author@email.com](mailto:a.author@email.com)',                   '[b.author@email.com](mailto:b.author@email.com)')   Institution(slick) <- c('A Institution', 'B Institution')

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Title, Subtitle, Introduction support multiple languages. Three languages supported: en: English es: Spanish fr: French Multiple languages can included providing named list: text throughout Slick Object supports Markdown multiple languages. App dropdown menu allows users select preferred language.
code: Title(slick) <- list(en='An Example Slick Object',                      es='Un ejemplo de un objeto Slick',                      fr="Un exemple d'objet Slick") Title(slick) #> [1] "An Example Slick Object"  Title(slick, 'es') #> [1] "Un ejemplo de un objeto Slick"  Title(slick, 'fr') #> [1] "Un exemple d'objet Slick"

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: MPs Object contains codes, labels, descriptions management procedures (MPs) included Slick Object, well options colors use plots, preset buttons appear App. Slick Objects must completed MPs Object. easiest way build Slick Object create populate sub-components add Slick Object.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Code, Label required, used plots tables, Description optional. example, 4 MPs: also done : using Metadata function:
code: mps <- MPs() Code(mps) <- c('AvC', 'Itarget1', 'DD', 'SPmod') Label(mps) <- c('Average Catch',                 'Index Target',                 'Delay Difference',                 'Surplus Production')  Description(mps) <- c('TAC is fixed for all years to the average catch from the historical period',                       'TAC is iteratively adjusted to reach a target CPUE',                       'Delay-difference assessment model used to estimate current biomass $(B)$ and $U_{MSY}$, and $\text{TAC}= U_{MSY}B$',                       'TAC is incrementally adjusted based on the apparent trend in surplus production') mps <- MPs(Code=c('AvC', 'Itarget1', 'DD', 'SPmod'),            Label=c('Average Catch',                    'Index Target',                    'Delay Difference',                    'Surplus Production'),            Description = c('TAC is fixed for all years to the average catch from the historical period',                            'TAC is iteratively adjusted to reach a target CPUE',                            'Delay-difference assessment model used to estimate current biomass $(B)$ and $U_{MSY}$, and $\text{TAC}= U_{MSY}B$',                            'TAC is incrementally adjusted based on the apparent trend in surplus production')) Metadata(mps) <- data.frame(   Code=c('AvC', 'Itarget1', 'DD', 'SPmod'),   Label=c('Average Catch',           'Index Target',           'Delay Difference',           'Surplus Production'),   Description=c('TAC is fixed for all years to the average catch from the historical period',                 'TAC is iteratively adjusted to reach a target CPUE',                 'Delay-difference assessment model used to estimate current biomass $(B)$ and $U_{MSY}$, and $\text{TAC}= U_{MSY}B$',                 'TAC is incrementally adjusted based on the apparent trend in surplus production') )  Metadata(mps) #>       Code              Label #> 1      AvC      Average Catch #> 2 Itarget1       Index Target #> 3       DD   Delay Difference #> 4    SPmod Surplus Production #>                                                                                                          Description #> 1                                         TAC is fixed for all years to the average catch from the historical period #> 2                                                                 TAC is iteratively adjusted to reach a target CPUE #> 3 Delay-difference assessment model used to estimate current biomass $(B)$ and $U_{MSY}$, and $\text{TAC}= U_{MSY}B$ #> 4                                    TAC is incrementally adjusted based on the apparent trend in surplus production #>     Color #> 1 #C87A8A #> 2 #909646 #> 3 #00A396 #> 4 #9189C7

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Color used set colors MPs shown plots. specified, default colors used:
code: Color(mps) #> [1] "#C87A8A" "#909646" "#00A396" "#9189C7"  Color(mps) <- colors()[sample(1:100,4)] Color(mps) #> [1] "darkorange1" "cyan1"       "coral"       "darkcyan"  # reset to default colors Color(mps) <- default_mp_colors(4)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Preset optional. used add buttons App users can rapidly select different sets MPs. MPs Object, Preset optional named list, numeric values indicating MPs selected Preset buttons App:
code: Preset(mps) <- list('All'=1:4,                     'Model-Free'=1:2,                     'Model-Based'=3:4)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: MPs Object complete, can added Slick Object:
code: MPs(slick) <- mps

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: OMs Object describes structure operating models contained Slick Object. Slick objects must completed OMs Object.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: new OMs Object can created OMs function: OMs Object contains two mandatory slots (Factors Design) one optional slot (Preset).
code: oms <- OMs()

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Factors data.frame column headings Factor, Level, Description. used describe various factors, levels within factor, operating models included Slick Object. simple example Slick Object includes results 6 OMs, spanning three levels uncertainty natural mortality (M) two levels steepness (h):
code: Factors(oms) <- data.frame(Factor='M',                            Level=c('Base', 'Lower', 'Higher'),                            Description=c('Base Case',                                          'Lower Natural Mortality',                                          'Higher Natural Mortality') )  Factors(oms) #>   Factor  Level              Description #> 1      M   Base                Base Case #> 2      M  Lower  Lower Natural Mortality #> 3      M Higher Higher Natural Mortality

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Design matrix nOM rows nFactor columns. values column either numeric values indicating levels corresponding factor, actual level values (.e., Factors$Level) correspond OM. column names Design must match names factors (.e, Factors$Level). Design matrix corresponding Factors : can sometimes helpful add names labels operating models listed Design. can done using rownames:
code: Design(oms) <- data.frame(M=c('Base', 'Lower', 'Higher'))  Design(oms) #>        M #> 1   Base #> 2  Lower #> 3 Higher rownames(Design(oms)) <- c('Base', 'Lower', 'Higher')

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Preset optional. used add buttons App users can rapidly select different sets OMs. OMs objects, Preset multi-level list. element first level lists must named. names used display ‘Preset’ button App. second level named list element must list length nFactors, element containing numeric values representing levels within factor included preset. example:
code: Preset(oms) <- list('All'=list(1:3),                     'Base'=list(1))

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: OMs object now complete: Check function can used make sure errors: OMs object complete, can added Slick object:
code: oms #>  #> ── An object of class `OMs` ──────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── `Factors` ── #>  #>   Factor  Level              Description #> 1      M   Base                Base Case #> 2      M  Lower  Lower Natural Mortality #> 3      M Higher Higher Natural Mortality #> ── `Design` ── #>             M #> Base     Base #> Lower   Lower #> Higher Higher #> ── `Preset` ── #> ── All #> 1 #> 2 #> 3 #>  #>  #> ── Base  #>  #> 1 Check(oms) #>  #> ── Checking: "OMs" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete OMs(slick) <- oms

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Information Time Series plot stored Timeseries Object. Timeseries Object can created using Timeseries function:
code: timeseries <- Timeseries()

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Either Code, Label, Description functions Metadata function can used add metadata information Timeseries Object. example three performance indicators Timeseries Object: plotting functions support Multi-Language Support Metadata information.
code: Metadata(timeseries) <- data.frame(   Code=c('SB/SBMSY', 'F/FMSY', 'Removals'),   Label=c('SB/SBMSY', 'F/FMSY', 'Removals'),   Description=c('Spawning biomass relative to equilibrium spawning biomass corresponding with maximum sustainable yield (MSY)',                 'Fishing mortality relative to F_MSY',                 'Removals (Landings + Discards)') )  Code(timeseries) #> [1] "SB/SBMSY" "F/FMSY"   "Removals"

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Time slot Timeseries Object numeric vector values historical projection time-steps. example, 50 historical years 50 projection years: TimeNow numeric value matching last historical time step (.e., current time) Time: TimeLab character string providing name time step Time. named list can used Multi-Language Support:
code: Time(timeseries) <- c(rev(seq(2024, by=-1, length.out=50)),                       seq(2025, by=1, length.out=50)) TimeNow(timeseries) <- 2024 TimeLab(timeseries) <- 'Year'

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Value 5-dimensional array containing values performance indicators simulation, OM, MP, performance indicator, time-step (historical projection): chunk code calculates three performance indicators OM openMSE results generated . can ignore MSE data. performance indicators calculated Time Series plot, can added Value slot:
code: nOM <- nrow(Design(slick)) nMP <- length(Code(mps)) nPI <- length(Code(timeseries)) nTS <- length(Time(timeseries))  Value(timeseries) <- array(NA, dim=c(nsim, nOM, nMP, nPI, nTS)) # SB/SBMSY SB_SBMSY_Base <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, MSE_Base@SSB_hist) |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                    MSE_Base@SSB,                    along=3)/MSE_Base@RefPoint$SSBMSY  SB_SBMSY_LowM <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, MSE_LowM@SSB_hist) |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                                MSE_LowM@SSB,                               along=3)/MSE_LowM@RefPoint$SSBMSY  SB_SBMSY_HighM <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, MSE_HighM@SSB_hist) |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                                MSE_HighM@SSB,                                along=3)/MSE_HighM@RefPoint$SSBMSY  # F/FMSY F_FMSY_Base <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, MSE_Base@FM_hist) |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                             MSE_Base@FM)/MSE_Base@RefPoint$FMSY  F_FMSY_LowM  <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, MSE_LowM@FM_hist) |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                              MSE_LowM@FM)/MSE_LowM@RefPoint$FMSY  F_FMSY_HighM  <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, MSE_HighM@FM_hist) |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                               MSE_HighM@FM)/MSE_HighM@RefPoint$FMSY  # Removals Removals_Base <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, apply(MSE_Base@Hist@TSdata$Removals, 1:2, sum))                               |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                               MSE_Base@Removals)  Removals_LowM  <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, apply(MSE_LowM@Hist@TSdata$Removals, 1:2, sum))                                |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                                MSE_LowM@Removals)  Removals_HighM  <- abind::abind(replicate(nMP, apply(MSE_HighM@Hist@TSdata$Removals, 1:2, sum))                                 |> aperm(c(1,3,2)),                                 MSE_HighM@Removals) # SB/SBMSY Value(timeseries)[,1,,1,] <- SB_SBMSY_Base Value(timeseries)[,2,,1,] <- SB_SBMSY_LowM Value(timeseries)[,3,,1,] <- SB_SBMSY_HighM  # F/FMSY Value(timeseries)[,1,,2,] <- F_FMSY_Base Value(timeseries)[,2,,2,] <- F_FMSY_LowM Value(timeseries)[,3,,2,] <- F_FMSY_HighM  # Removals Value(timeseries)[,1,,3,] <- Removals_Base Value(timeseries)[,2,,3,] <- Removals_LowM Value(timeseries)[,3,,3,] <- Removals_HighM

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: plotting object Preset slot. However, feature currently supported Timeseries plots.

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Target Limit optional. used provide horizontal lines time series plot indicating target limit (applicable) performance indicator. color labels can
code: Target(timeseries) <- c(1, 0.8, NA) Limit(timeseries) <- c(0.5, 1, NA)

what: Adding Timeseries Object to Slick Object
title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Timeseries Object complete can checked: added Slick Object:
code: Check(timeseries) #>  #> ── Checking: "Timeseries" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete Timeseries(slick) <- timeseries

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: plotTimeseries function used generate Time Series plot:    plot can faceted management procedure:  operating model:  :  See ?plotTimeseries information ways modify Time Series plot. default, time series values calculated mean operating models. FilterSlick function can used filter Slick Object specific OMs, MPs, PIs. filtering include Base Case OM (OM 1):
code: plotTimeseries(slick) # PI 1 plotTimeseries(slick, 2, # PI 2, no quantiles                includeQuants = FALSE) plotTimeseries(slick,3, # PI 3, no quantiles, no MP labels                includeQuants = FALSE,                includeLabels = FALSE) plotTimeseries(slick, byMP=TRUE) plotTimeseries(slick, byOM=TRUE) plotTimeseries(slick, byOM=TRUE, byMP=TRUE) slick_OM1 <- FilterSlick(slick, OMs=1, plot='Timeseries')  plotTimeseries(slick_OM1, byOM=TRUE) plotTimeseries(slick_OM1) # same plot

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Slick Object now complete minimum requirements: complete MPs Object complete OMs Object least one complete Plot Object (Timeseries case) Slick Object can checked completeness Check function: loaded directly App named argument:
code: Check(slick) #>  #> ── Checking: "Slick" ── #>  #> ── Checking: "MPs" #> ✔ Complete #>  #> ── Checking: "OMs" #> ✔ Complete #>  #> ── Checking: "Boxplot" #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #> ── Checking: "Quilt" #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #> ── Checking: "Kobe" #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #> ── Checking: "Spider" #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #> ── Checking: "Timeseries" #> ✔ Complete #>  #> ── Checking: "Tradeoff" #> ℹ Object is empty App(slick=slick)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: documentation remaining plots briefer assumes ’ve read Time Series Plot section. Information Boxplot stored Boxplot Object. Boxplot Object can created using Boxplot function. populating metadata directly create Boxplot object: Value numeric array containing values performance indicators included Boxplot object. Value must dimensions c(nsim, nOM, nMP, nPI): Check Boxplot object add Slick Object: plotBoxplot function used create Boxplot Slick Object:  option violin plots:  types:  byOM=TRUE argument creates boxplot given performance indicator OM Slick Object:  See ?plotBoxplot options plotBoxplot function. FilterSlick can used filter OMs /MPs include given plot:
code: boxplot <- Boxplot(Code=c('SB/SBSMY 25', 'SB/SBSMY 50', 'TAC 25'),                    Label=c('SB/SBMSY Year 25', 'SB/SBSMY Year 50', 'TAC Year 25'),                    Description=c('SB/SBMSY in the 25th projection year',                                  'SB/SBMSY in the last year',                                  'TAC in the 25th projection year')) nOM <- nrow(Design(slick)) nMP <- length(Code(mps)) nPI <- length(Code(boxplot))  Value(boxplot) <- array(NA, dim=c(nsim, nOM, nMP, nPI))  Value(boxplot)[,1,,1] <- MSE_Base@SB_SBMSY[,,25] Value(boxplot)[,2,,1] <- MSE_LowM@SB_SBMSY[,,25] Value(boxplot)[,3,,1] <- MSE_HighM@SB_SBMSY[,,25]  Value(boxplot)[,1,,2] <- MSE_Base@SB_SBMSY[,,50] Value(boxplot)[,2,,2] <- MSE_LowM@SB_SBMSY[,,50] Value(boxplot)[,3,,2] <- MSE_HighM@SB_SBMSY[,,50]  Value(boxplot)[,1,,3] <- MSE_Base@TAC[,,25] Value(boxplot)[,2,,3] <- MSE_LowM@TAC[,,25] Value(boxplot)[,3,,3] <- MSE_HighM@TAC[,,25] Check(boxplot) #>  #> ── Checking: "Boxplot" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete Boxplot(slick) <- boxplot plotBoxplot(slick) plotBoxplot(slick, type='violin') plotBoxplot(slick, type='both') plotBoxplot(slick, byOM=TRUE) plotBoxplot(FilterSlick(slick, MPs=1:3, OMs=1:2, plot='Boxplot'),             byOM=TRUE)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Information Kobe Plot stored Kobe Object. Kobe Object can created using Kobe function. populating metadata directly create Kobe object: Time slot Kobe Object contains numeric values projection time-steps: Value numeric array containing values performance indicators included Kobe Object. Value must dimensions c(nsim, nOM, nMP, nPI, nTS): Check add Slick Object: Plot Kobe plot:  Plot Kobe Time plot:  See ?plotKobe options plotKobe function.
code: kobe <- Kobe(Code=c('SB/SBMSY', 'F/FMSY'),              Label=c('SB/SBMSY', 'F/FMSY'),              Description = c('Spawning biomass relative to SB_MSY',                              'Fishing mortality relative to F_MSY') ) Time(kobe) <- seq(2025, by=1, length.out=OM_Base@proyears) nOM <- nrow(Design(slick)) nMP <- length(Code(mps)) nPI <- length(Code(kobe)) nTS <- length(Time(kobe))  Value(kobe) <- array(NA, dim=c(nsim, nOM, nMP, nPI, nTS))  Value(kobe)[,1,,1,] <- MSE_Base@SB_SBMSY Value(kobe)[,2,,1,] <- MSE_LowM@SB_SBMSY Value(kobe)[,3,,1,] <- MSE_HighM@SB_SBMSY  Value(kobe)[,1,,2,] <- MSE_Base@F_FMSY Value(kobe)[,2,,2,] <- MSE_LowM@F_FMSY Value(kobe)[,3,,2,] <- MSE_HighM@F_FMSY Check(kobe) #>  #> ── Checking: "Kobe" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete Kobe(slick) <- kobe plotKobe(slick) plotKobe(slick, Time=TRUE)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Information Quilt Plot stored Quilt Object. Quilt Object can created using Quilt function. populating metadata directly create Quilt object: Value numeric array containing values performance indicators included Quilt Object. Value must dimensions c(nOM, nMP, nPI): MinValue MaxValue functions can used set minimum maximum values calculating colored shading PI: Check add Slick Object: default Quilt plot: Shading scaled minimum maximum PI: static table shading: MP PGK P100 PNOF Mean TAC AvC 0.89 0.90 0.93 930 Itarget1 0.91 0.95 0.95 940 DD 0.48 0.53 0.60 1,000 SPmod 0.16 0.22 0.20 870 See ?plotQuilt options plotQuilt function.
code: quilt <- Quilt(Code=c('PGK',                       'P100',                       'PNOF',                       'Mean TAC'),                Label=c('Prob. Green Kobe',                        'Prob SB>SBMSY',                        'Prob. Not Overfishing',                        'Mean Total Allowable Catch'),                Description = c('Probability of being in the green region of Kobe plot over the projection period',                                'Probability spawning biomass is greater than SB_MSY over the projection period',                                'Probability of not overfishing over the projection period',                                'Mean Total Allowable Catch over the projection period')) nPI <- length(Code(quilt))  Value(quilt) <- array(NA, dim=c(nOM, nMP, nPI))  Value(quilt)[1,,1] <- apply(MSE_Base@SB_SBMSY > 1 & MSE_Base@F_FMSY < 1, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[2,,1] <- apply(MSE_LowM@SB_SBMSY > 1 & MSE_LowM@F_FMSY < 1, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[3,,1] <- apply(MSE_HighM@SB_SBMSY > 1 & MSE_HighM@F_FMSY < 1, 2, mean)  Value(quilt)[1,,2] <- apply(MSE_Base@SB_SBMSY > 1, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[2,,2] <- apply(MSE_LowM@SB_SBMSY > 1, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[3,,2] <- apply(MSE_HighM@SB_SBMSY > 1, 2, mean)  Value(quilt)[1,,3] <- apply(MSE_Base@F_FMSY < 1, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[2,,3] <- apply(MSE_LowM@F_FMSY < 1, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[3,,3] <- apply(MSE_HighM@F_FMSY < 1, 2, mean)  Value(quilt)[1,,4] <- apply(MSE_Base@TAC, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[2,,4] <- apply(MSE_LowM@TAC, 2, mean) Value(quilt)[3,,4] <- apply(MSE_HighM@TAC, 2, mean) MinValue(quilt) <- c(0,0,0,NA) MaxValue(quilt) <- c(1,1,1,NA) Check(quilt) #>  #> ── Checking: "Quilt" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete  Quilt(slick) <- quilt plotQuilt(slick) plotQuilt(slick, minmax=TRUE) plotQuilt(slick, shading=FALSE, kable=TRUE)

title: Slick Developer's Guide
text: Information Spider Plot stored Spider Object. Spider Object can created using Spider function. populating metadata directly create Spider object: Value numeric array containing values performance indicators included Spider Object. Value must dimensions c(nOM, nMP, nPI): things consider Value Spider plot: values Performance Indicator must scale, high values indicating better performance Values negative values 0 1, 0 100, 1 100 representing highest possible value Performance Indicator. Check add Slick Object: default Spider Plot:  Option include fill color:  Plot MP:  OM MP:  See ?plotSpider options plotSpider function.
code: spider <- Spider(Code=c('P100',                       'P50',                       'PNOF',                       'Yield'),                Label=c('Prob SB>SBMSY',                        'Prob SB>0.5SBMSY',                        'Prob. Not Overfishing',                        'Prob. Mean Yield > 50%'),                Description = c('Probability spawning biomass is greater than SB_MSY over the projection period',                                'Probability spawning biomass is greater than 0.5 SB_MSY over the projection period',                                'Probability of not overfishing over the projection period',                                'Probability mean yield is greater than 50% of the reference yield')) nPI <- length(Code(spider))  Value(spider) <- array(NA, dim=c(nOM, nMP, nPI))  Value(spider)[1,,1] <- MSEtool::P100(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(spider)[2,,1] <- MSEtool::P100(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(spider)[3,,1] <- MSEtool::P100(MSE_HighM)@Mean  Value(spider)[1,,2] <- MSEtool::P50(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(spider)[2,,2] <- MSEtool::P50(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(spider)[3,,2] <- MSEtool::P50(MSE_HighM)@Mean  Value(spider)[1,,3] <- MSEtool::PNOF(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(spider)[2,,3] <- MSEtool::PNOF(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(spider)[3,,3] <- MSEtool::PNOF(MSE_HighM)@Mean   Value(spider)[1,,4] <- MSEtool::LTY(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(spider)[2,,4] <- MSEtool::LTY(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(spider)[3,,4] <- MSEtool::LTY(MSE_HighM)@Mean Check(spider) #>  #> ── Checking: "Spider" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete  Spider(slick) <- spider plotSpider(slick) plotSpider(slick, fill=TRUE) plotSpider(slick, byMP=TRUE) plotSpider(slick, byOM=TRUE, incMean = FALSE)

code: tradeoff <- Tradeoff(Code=c('P100',                         'P50',                         'PNOF',                         'Yield'),                  Label=c('Prob SB>SBMSY',                          'Prob SB>0.5SBMSY',                          'Prob. Not Overfishing',                          'Prob. Mean Yield > 50%'),                  Description = c('Probability spawning biomass is greater than SB_MSY over the projection period',                                  'Probability spawning biomass is greater than 0.5 SB_MSY over the projection period',                                  'Probability of not overfishing over the projection period',                                  'Probability mean yield is greater than 50% of the reference yield')) nPI <- length(Code(tradeoff))  Value(tradeoff) <- array(NA, dim=c(nOM, nMP, nPI))  Value(tradeoff)[1,,1] <- MSEtool::P100(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[2,,1] <- MSEtool::P100(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[3,,1] <- MSEtool::P100(MSE_HighM)@Mean  Value(tradeoff)[1,,2] <- MSEtool::P50(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[2,,2] <- MSEtool::P50(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[3,,2] <- MSEtool::P50(MSE_HighM)@Mean  Value(tradeoff)[1,,3] <- MSEtool::PNOF(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[2,,3] <- MSEtool::PNOF(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[3,,3] <- MSEtool::PNOF(MSE_HighM)@Mean   Value(tradeoff)[1,,4] <- MSEtool::LTY(MSE_Base)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[2,,4] <- MSEtool::LTY(MSE_LowM)@Mean Value(tradeoff)[3,,4] <- MSEtool::LTY(MSE_HighM)@Mean Check(tradeoff) #>  #> ── Checking: "Tradeoff" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete  Tradeoff(slick) <- tradeoff plotTradeoff(slick) plotTradeoff(slick, 1:2, 3:4) # saveRDS(slick, 'C:/users/adrian/desktop/slick.slick')  # Testslick <- readRDS('C:/Users/adrian/Documents/GitHub/SlickLibrary/Slick_Objects/Western_Atlantic_Skipjack.slick')

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick R package designed visualizing exploring results Management Strategy Evaluation (MSE). MSE involves using closed-loop simulation testing evaluate compare expected performance alternative management methods, often call Management Procedures (MPs), across different hypotheses historical future fishery dynamics, referred Operating Models (OMs). results MSE reported set Performance Indicators (PIs), quantitative measures management objectives fishery stakeholders, managers, decision-makers. Slick allows MSE developers analysts prepare MSE results standardized data structure, easily generate publication quality figures tables, present explore MSE results interactive application.

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick released CRAN future. meantime, Slick can installed Github:
code: # install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('blue-matter/Slick') library(Slick)

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: use Slick, results MSE must available Slick data object. Slick App includes several example data objects. See Developer’s Guide documentation creating Slick Data object MSE results.

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick App designed interactively examining MSE results contained within Slick data object. App allows simultaneous presentation various performance metrics can account uncertainty states nature. Slick interactive allows users filter results live order explore robustness performance. Slick can applied decision analysis context specifically designed investigate performance fisheries management procedures tested management strategy evaluation (MSE). Importantly App platform agnostic: results arising MSE framework formatted compatible Slick object can loaded visualized App.

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick App can run locally accessed online. run App locally, simply run App(). example data objects can loaded within App, Slick data object can uploaded. Slick data object, object can loaded directly : mySlick completed Slick data object.
code: App(slick=mySlick)

title: Boxplot S4 Object Class — Boxplot-class
code: boxplot <- Boxplot(Code=c('PI1', 'PI2', 'PI3'),                    Label=c('Performance Indicator 1',                          'Performance Indicator 2',                          'Performance Indicator 3'),                    Description = c('This is the description for PI 1',                                    'This is the description for PI 2',                                    'This is the description for PI 3'),                    Value=array(runif(3000), dim=c(6, 5, 4, 3)),                    Preset=list('PI and P2'=1:2)  )  boxplot #>  #> ── An object of class `Boxplot` ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── `Code` ── #>  #> 1 PI1 #> 2 PI2 #> 3 PI3 #>  #> ── `Label` ── #>  #> 1 Performance Indicator 1 #> 2 Performance Indicator 2 #> 3 Performance Indicator 3 #>  #> ── `Description` ── #>  #> 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3 This is the description for PI 3 #>  #> ── `Value` ── #>  #>   Dimension Length #> 1      nsim      6 #> 2       nOM      5 #> 3       nMP      4 #> 4       nPI      3 #>  #> ℹ Mean across MPs and PIs #>       PI1  PI2  PI3 #> MP 1 0.46 0.54 0.52 #> MP 2 0.49 0.57 0.50 #> MP 3 0.45 0.49 0.49 #> MP 4 0.58 0.57 0.52 #>  #> ── `Preset` ── #>  #> ── PI and P2  #> 1 #> 2  Code(boxplot) <- c('LTY', 'STY', 'P50') Metadata(boxplot) #>   Code                   Label                      Description #> 1  LTY Performance Indicator 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2  STY Performance Indicator 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3  P50 Performance Indicator 3 This is the description for PI 3   # Add to `Slick` object slick <- Slick() Boxplot(slick) <- boxplot  plotBoxplot(slick) #> Error in data.frame(Sim = 1:nsim, OM = rep(OM_labels, each = nsim), MP = rep(MP_lab,     each = nsim * nOM), PI = rep(PI_names, each = nsim * nOM *     nMP), value = as.vector(values)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 6, 0, 30, 360  plotBoxplot(slick, type='violin') #> Error in data.frame(Sim = 1:nsim, OM = rep(OM_labels, each = nsim), MP = rep(MP_lab,     each = nsim * nOM), PI = rep(PI_names, each = nsim * nOM *     nMP), value = as.vector(values)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 6, 0, 30, 360  plotBoxplot(slick, type='both') #> Error in data.frame(Sim = 1:nsim, OM = rep(OM_labels, each = nsim), MP = rep(MP_lab,     each = nsim * nOM), PI = rep(PI_names, each = nsim * nOM *     nMP), value = as.vector(values)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 6, 0, 30, 360

title: S4 class Kobe — Kobe-class
text: Code short code Performance Indicators object. character string length nPI named list multi-language support. See Details Label short label Performance Indicators object. Used label axes charts. Can longer Code recommended keep short possible shows clearly plots tables. character string length nPI named list multi-language support. See Details Description description Performance Indicators object. Can include Markdown, see Examples. character string length nPI named list multi-language support. See Details Time numeric vector values projection time-steps. Must match length nTS Value TimeLab Character string length 1. Name time step (e.g., 'Year'). used label Kobe Time plot. Use named list multiple languages. Value numeric array stochastic performance indicator values simulation (sim), operating model (OM), management procedure (MP), performance indicator (PI), projection time-steps (nTS) Dimensions: c(nsim, nOM, nMP, nPI, nTS) Preset optional named list preset buttons App(). name list element appear button App(). Target Numeric vector length nPI target value PIs. Defines color quadrants Kobe plot. Defaults 1. Limit Numeric vector length nPI limit value two PIs. Shows red line Kobe plot. NULL ignore. Defaults list object default selections Kobe See Kobe-methods()

code: Make_Slick(   name = "Unnamed Slick object",   OM = NULL,   MPs = c("DCAC", "AvC", "Fratio", "FMSYref", "FMSYref50", "matlenlim"),   MP_Desc = NULL,   PMs = c("AAVE", "AAVY", "LTY", "P10", "P50", "P100", "PNOF", "STY", "Yield"),   Design = as.data.frame(cbind(rbind(as.matrix(expand.grid(1:2, 1:3, 1:2)), matrix(1,     nrow = 5, ncol = 3)), c(rep(1, 12), 2:6))),   SN = list(Factor_Labels = c("Natural Mortality", "Resilience", "Stock Depletion",     "Robustness"), Labels = list(c("M=0.2", "M=0.3"), c("h=0.5", "h=0.7", "h=0.9"),     c("Dep=0.1", "Dep=0.3"), c("Ref_Case", "L50=0.5", "Vmaxlen=0.1", "Cobs=0.5",     "Perr=0.5", "AC=0.95")), Codes = list(c("M2", "M3"), c("h5", "h7", "h9"), c("D1",     "D3"), c("Ref_case", "mat_low", "dome", "h_Cerr", "h_Perr", "h_AC")), Description =     list(c("M=0.2", "M=0.3"), c("h=0.5", "h=0.7", "h=0.9"), c("Dep=0.1", "Dep=0.3"),     c("Reference Case",       "L50=0.5", "Vmaxlen=0.1", "Cobs=0.5", "Perr=0.5",     "AC=0.95"))),   mods = list(function(OM, lev) { if (lev == 1) OM@M <- c(0.2, 0.2)      if (lev ==     2) OM@M <- c(0.3, 0.3)      OM  }, function(OM, lev) {      if (lev == 1) OM@h <-     c(0.5, 0.5) if (lev == 2) OM@h = c(0.7, 0.7)      if (lev == 3) OM@h = c(0.9,     0.9)      OM  }, function(OM, lev) { if (lev == 1) OM@D <- c(0.1, 0.1)      if     (lev == 2) OM@D <- c(0.3, 0.3)      OM  }, function(OM, lev) {      if (lev == 2) OM@L50 <- c(0.5, 0.5) if (lev == 3) OM@Vmaxlen = c(0.1, 0.1)      if (lev == 4)     OM@Cobs = c(0.5, 0.5) if (lev == 5) OM@Perr = c(0.5, 0.5)      if (lev == 6)     OM@AC = c(0.9, 0.9)      OM  }),   nsim = 48,   MSElist = NULL,   fstYr = NULL,   returnMSEs = F )

code:
library(Slick) # Assign values to a new `Slick` object slick <- Slick()  Title(slick) <- 'An Example Slick Object' Subtitle(slick) <- "[Created for the Developer's Guide](https://slick.bluematterscience.com/articles/DevelopersGuide.html)" Date(slick) <- Sys.Date() Author(slick) <- 'Adrian Hordyk' Email(slick) <-  "[mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) <- "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)"  Introduction(slick) <- " This is an example Slick object. It has been created for the purposes of demonstrating the key features of Slick.  The introduction can include paragraphs as well as Markdown such as *italics* and **bold** text and [Links](https://slick.bluematterscience.com). "  # Access values from `Slick` object Title(slick) #> [1] "An Example Slick Object" Subtitle(slick) #> [1] "[Created for the Developer's Guide](https://slick.bluematterscience.com/articles/DevelopersGuide.html)" Date(slick) #> [1] "2024-10-02" Author(slick) #> [1] "Adrian Hordyk" Email(slick) #> [1] "[mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) #> [1] "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)" Introduction(slick) #> [1] "
This is an example Slick object. It has been created for the purposes of demonstrating the key features of Slick.

The introduction can include paragraphs as well as Markdown such as *italics* and **bold** text and [Links](https://slick.bluematterscience.com).
"  # See ?MPs, ?OMs, ?Boxplot, ?Quilt, etc for examples on populating other # objects

title: Plot Boxplot — plotBoxplot
code: boxplot <- Boxplot(Code=c('PI1', 'PI2', 'PI3'),                    Label=c('Performance Indicator 1',                          'Performance Indicator 2',                          'Performance Indicator 3'),                    Description = c('This is the description for PI 1',                                    'This is the description for PI 2',                                    'This is the description for PI 3'),                    Value=array(runif(3000), dim=c(6, 5, 4, 3)),                    Preset=list('PI and P2'=1:2)  )  boxplot #>  #> ── An object of class `Boxplot` ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── `Code` ── #>  #> 1 PI1 #> 2 PI2 #> 3 PI3 #>  #> ── `Label` ── #>  #> 1 Performance Indicator 1 #> 2 Performance Indicator 2 #> 3 Performance Indicator 3 #>  #> ── `Description` ── #>  #> 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3 This is the description for PI 3 #>  #> ── `Value` ── #>  #>   Dimension Length #> 1      nsim      6 #> 2       nOM      5 #> 3       nMP      4 #> 4       nPI      3 #>  #> ℹ Mean across MPs and PIs #>       PI1  PI2  PI3 #> MP 1 0.58 0.45 0.53 #> MP 2 0.55 0.60 0.57 #> MP 3 0.48 0.51 0.50 #> MP 4 0.40 0.55 0.46 #>  #> ── `Preset` ── #>  #> ── PI and P2  #> 1 #> 2  Code(boxplot) <- c('LTY', 'STY', 'P50') Metadata(boxplot) #>   Code                   Label                      Description #> 1  LTY Performance Indicator 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2  STY Performance Indicator 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3  P50 Performance Indicator 3 This is the description for PI 3   # Add to `Slick` object slick <- Slick() Boxplot(slick) <- boxplot  plotBoxplot(slick) #> Error in data.frame(Sim = 1:nsim, OM = rep(OM_labels, each = nsim), MP = rep(MP_lab,     each = nsim * nOM), PI = rep(PI_names, each = nsim * nOM *     nMP), value = as.vector(values)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 6, 0, 30, 360  plotBoxplot(slick, type='violin') #> Error in data.frame(Sim = 1:nsim, OM = rep(OM_labels, each = nsim), MP = rep(MP_lab,     each = nsim * nOM), PI = rep(PI_names, each = nsim * nOM *     nMP), value = as.vector(values)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 6, 0, 30, 360  plotBoxplot(slick, type='both') #> Error in data.frame(Sim = 1:nsim, OM = rep(OM_labels, each = nsim), MP = rep(MP_lab,     each = nsim * nOM), PI = rep(PI_names, each = nsim * nOM *     nMP), value = as.vector(values)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 6, 0, 30, 360
